div.p: This has been a rather strange couple weeks, to say the least. However, that doesn’t mean we have to be bored out of our minds. I did numerous activities while being trapped by this awful virus. I did the laundry which completely shocked my family and mostly my mom. I’ve played numerous video games and pickup basketball games at the park in Massena with my brothers and all of our friends. Finally, the activity I’m most . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Quarantine Fun Time

h3.a: CAM Spring Athletic Awards Banquet….That Wasn’t!!

div.p:
Due to the unexpected break from school, from the COVID-19 Pandemic, the CAM spring athletic banquet was canceled. The girls’ athletic awards that would have given out that evening were the following. Congratulations to all the girls who received awards and who were members of CAM Girls Basketball Team! You can be very proud of a great year!
Girls Varsity Letterwinners:
Sammi Jahde . . .

div.p:
Cass County Fair Information
Please note the new guidelines as we move forward for Cass County FFA Exhibitors:
All county weigh-ins for swine, meat goats and sheep have been canceled. You may pick up Swine, Sheep and Goat tags at any time from the Extension Office. Please call ahead and let them know when you are planning to pick them up and they will have them ready for you. Just a . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Cass County Fair Information

div.p: The Scoop-the-Loop event was just what this community needed, to lift our spirits during the COVID-19 pandemic that has gripped the nation and the world. Anita hosted their Scoop-the-Loop night on Saturday, April 4, 2020, with over 100 vehicles participating. One that is certain, Anita and the surrounding communities can be counted on to support each other and our school. Our neighbors and friends showed up to catch a . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Anita Scoop-the-Loop Event Fantastic Success!

h3.a: FREE AEA Resources for Online Education

div.p:
High-Quality, No-Cost Resources for School & Home!
Iowa’s AEAs provide Iowa students and educators with no-cost access to 16 high-quality, vetted digital resources. The resources are available anytime, anywhere! Please click the link to get AEA's resources.
http://www.iowaaea.org/how-we- can-help/iowa-aea-online/

a.aria-label: Read more about FREE AEA Resources for Online Education

div.p: This quarantine is something that has been harder than expected. It has been strange to stay home for the past two weeks, and not do anything, especially when I spend a lot of time with my friends. Mrs. Miller thought it would be a good idea to share-out what we have been doing over our “break”, and I couldn’t agree more. Here are some things my family and I have been doing to keep busy; my siblings and I cleaned, . . .

div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 21:55 pm CDT

div.span: A 30 percent chance of showers, mainly after 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 38. North northwest wind around 6 mph becoming calm after midnight. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

A 30 percent chance of showers, mainly before 9am. Cloudy, then gradually becoming mostly sunny, with a high near 65. Breezy, with a light southwest wind becoming west 12 to 17 mph in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 26 mph. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.
Mostly clear, with a low around 35. Breezy, with a north northwest wind 9 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.
